overview: It is a found footage film made for two 16mm projectors from a selection of various film archives that take place between the end of the 40s and the beginning of the 60s, which includes different uses of the 16mm format: from the anonymous amateur and the moments considered happy, going through popular documentaries, television and narrative cinema. The montage of images is organized around the poem "To Marilyn" by the filmmaker, writer and poet Pier Paolo Pasolini, performed in off by the Italian poet Giorgio Bassani.
